alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Fayette County through 845 PM CST... At 759 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Flatonia, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... La Grange, Schulenburg, Fayetteville, Round Top, Muldoon, Swiss Alp, Freyburg, Dubina, Rutersville, Warrenton, High Hill, Engle, O`Quinn, Floy, Ellinger, Walhalla, Willow Springs, Ammannsville, Winedale, and Rek Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. A Flash Flood Warning is in effect for Fayette County through 1030 PM. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
